articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday the next few days will determine how serious Russian President Vladimir Putin is about peace in Ukraine, as U.S. officials fly out to Saudi Arabia for meetings with Russian officials.
articles.title: Rubio says coming days will show if Putin serious about Ukraine peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department's Taiwan page last week removed a previous reference to not supporting Taiwan's independence.
articles.title: What is 'Taiwan independence' and is Taiwan already independent?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has received a shipment of heavy MK-84 bombs from the United States, after U.S. President Donald Trump lifted a block imposed on the export of the munitions by the administration of predecessor Joe Biden, the defence ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel receives shipment of heavy bombs cleared by Trump

articles.author: Maha Dahan, Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: Iraq's central bank will ban five more local banks from engaging in U.S. dollar transactions, a move that comes after meetings with U.S. Treasury officials in efforts to combat money laundering, dollar smuggling and other violations, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Sunday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Five Iraqi banks to be banned from U.S. dollar transactions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's air defence units intercepted and destroyed 90 Ukrainian drones overnight, the Russian defence ministry said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia says it destroys 90 Ukrainian drones overnight

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The case could offer a preview of how the Supreme Court will view Trump's aggressive moves to remake government, including by removing heads of independent agencies.
articles.title: Trump administration turns to US Supreme Court in bid to fire agency head

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has paid his respect at a family mausoleum to mark the birthday of his late father and former leader Kim Jong Il, state media KCNA said on Monday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim makes rare visit to father's tomb

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday he believes he could meet "very soon" with Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Trump says he could meet with Putin 'very soon' on Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Russian Navy's large landing ship, Admiral Nevelskoy, conducted artillery firing drills in the Sea of ​​Japan, Russian news agency Interfax reported on Monday, citing the press service of the Pacific Fleet.
articles.title: Russian Navy warship holds artillery firing drills in Sea of ​​Japan, Interfax reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least one person was injured in Russian overnight air attacks that also started a fire in a critical infrastructure building in the southern city of Mykolaiv and damaged several houses in the Kyiv region, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russian overnight attacks injure one, damage infrastructure, houses, Ukraine officials say
